Created With

linkGolden Gadget

linkGGArray

A wrapper of an Array offering a rich selection of general utility functions.

Note: Arrays (and other types) passed and returned are considered immutable. It is recommended to not mutate them.
If you break this rule, it may lead to unexpected consequences.

Type parameter T (any) is the type items in GGArray.

linkvar GGI

@internal

linkvar val

Inner Array. Usually used to end GGArray chains.

Type: Array<T>

Examples: G([1, 2]).val returns [1, 2]

linkvar size

Get length of the wrapped array.

Type: int

Examples: G([1, 2]).size returns 2

linkvar is_empty

Is the wrapped array empty?

Type: bool

Examples: G([]).is_empty returns true
G([1, 2]).is_empty returns false

linkfunc map_fn(f, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT) -> GGArray

Map every value in an array using a given function.

Type parameters: U: any Output GGArray item type

Parameters: f: Func<T, U> Mapping function (FuncRef or CtxFRef1) ctx: any Context for function

Returns: U

Examples: G([1, 2]).map_fn(GG.inc_).val returns [2, 3]

linkfunc map(f, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT) -> GGArray

Similar to map_fn, but also supports function-like type.

Type parameters: U: any Output GGArray item type

Parameters:
f: FuncLike<T, U> Mapping function
ctx: any Context for function

Returns: U

Examples: G([1, 2]).map("x => x + 1").val returns [2, 3]

linkfunc map_out_mtd(obj: Object, method_name: String, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT) -> GGArray

Map an outer method (method of one specific object, usually one from which call originates - self)

linkfunc map_in_mtd(inner_method_name: String, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT) -> GGArray

Map an inner method (a method on objects in GGArray item).

linkfunc map_fld(field_name: String) -> GGArray

Map a field in Object or Dictionary.

Examples: G([{name = "Spock"}, {name = "Scotty"}]).map_fld("name").val returns ["Spock", "Scotty"]

linkfunc for_each(f, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT) -> void

Call a function for every value in an array.

Examples: G(["Firefly", "Daedalus"]).for_each("x -> print(x)") prints Firefly and Daedalus on separate lines (two calls)

linkfunc join(delim: String = "", before: String = "", after: String = "") -> String

Join an array of Strings.

Examples: G(["Dog", "Cat", "Frog"]).join(", ") returns "Dog, Cat, Frog"
G([1, 2, 3]).join(", ", "<", ">") returns "<1, 2, 3>"

linkfunc join_w(delim: String = "", before: String = "", after: String = "") -> GGArray

Similar as join, but wraps a result in GGArray.

linkfunc filter_fn(predicate, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT) -> GGArray

Filter out values from an array for which predicate function returns false.

linkfunc filter(predicate, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT) -> GGArray

Similar to filter_fn, but supports FuncLike.

Examples: G(range(-4, 4)).filter("x => x >= 2").val returns [2, 3]

linkfunc filter_out_mtd(obj: Object, method_name: String, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT) -> GGArray

Filter contents using a method on one specific Object.

linkfunc filter_in_mtd(inner_method_name: String, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT) -> GGArray

Filter contents using a method on each item in an array.

linkfunc filter_by_fld(field_name: String) -> GGArray

Filter an array of objects using bool field.

Examples: G([{enabled = true, id = 0}, {enabled = false, id = 1}, {enabled = true, id = 2}]).filter_by_fld("enabled").map_fld("id").val returns [0, 2]

linkfunc filter_by_fld_val(field_name: String, field_value) -> GGArray

Filter an array of objects using one field and field value.

Examples: G([{id = 0, name = "Zero"}, {id = 1, name = "One"}]).filter_by_fld_val("id", 1).map_fld("name").val returns ["One"]

linkfunc without(value_to_omit) -> GGArray

Return a new GGArray omitting given value.

Examples: G([1, 2, 1]).without(1).val returns [2]

linkfunc compact() -> GGArray

Return a new GGArray omitting null items.

Examples: G([1, null, 3]).compact().val returns [1, 3]

linkfunc find_or_null(predicate, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT)

Find a first element for which predicate holds. Crash on no match.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3], "x => x > 1") returns 2
G([1], "x => x > 1") returns null
G([{id = 4, name = "Alice"}, {id = 7, name = "Bob"}]).find_or_null("x => x.name.length() == 3").id returns 7

linkfunc find(predicate, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT)

Find a first element for which predicate holds. Return null when no match is found.

linkfunc find_by_fld_val(field_name: String, field_value)

Find an item by a value of a field.

Examples: G([{id = 0, name = "Zero"}, {id = 1, name = "One"}]).find_by_fld_val("id", 1).name returns "One"

linkfunc find_index_or_null(predicate, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT)

Find item in array for which precate holds and return its index.

Parameters: predicate: Func<T, bool>
ctx: any

Returns: int | null

linkfunc find_index(predicate, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT)

Find item in array for which precate holds and return its index. Crash when valid item isn't found.

Parameters: predicate: Func<T, bool>
ctx: any

Returns: int

linkfunc foldl_fn(f: FuncRef, zero, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT)

Takes an operator and a zero (initial) value, reduces array to one value by repeatedly applying the operator to items from an array.

Parameters: f: Func<R, T, R> Operator

Returns: R

linkfunc foldl(f, zero, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT)

Similar to foldl_fn, but also supports FuncLike.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3]).foldl("a, x => a + x", -6) returns 0 (-6 + 1 + 2 + 3)

linkfunc foldl_mtd(obj: Object, method_name: String, zero, ctx = GGI._EMPTY_CONTEXT)

Same as foldl_fn, but instead of a FuncRef takes an object and a name of its method.

linkfunc to(f)

Calls FuncLike on the inner value.

linkfunc to_w(f) -> GGArray

Calls FuncLike on the inner value and wraps the result in GGArray.

linkfunc head()

Get first item or crash on empty array.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3]).head() returns 1

linkfunc head_or_null()

Get first item or null for empty array.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3]).head_or_null() returns 1

linkfunc last()

Get last item or crash on empty array.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3]).last() returns 3

linkfunc last_or_null()

Get last item or null for empty array.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3]).last() returns 3

linkfunc tail() -> GGArray

Get all items except first one.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3]).tail().val returns [2, 3]

linkfunc init() -> GGArray

Get all items except last one.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3]).init().val returns [1, 2]

linkfunc sort() -> GGArray

Return a sorted GGArray.

linkfunc sort_by(cmp_f: FuncRef) -> GGArray

Sort an array using a supplied compare function.

linkfunc sort_by_fld(field_name: String) -> GGArray

Sort an array of objects by one given field.

linkfunc sort_with(map_f: FuncRef) -> GGArray

Sort an array using a mapping function (result is sorted on values obtained from the mapping function).

linkfunc zip(other: Array) -> GGArray

Zip together two arrays.
A length of a result is same length as a length of a shorter array (meaning arrays are not padded with nulls to be of same length, but the larger array is truncated to match the length of the shorter one).

Examples: G([1, 2]).zip(["a", "b"]).val returns [[1, "a"], [2, "b"]]
G([1]).zip(["a", "b"]).val returns [[1, "a"]]

linkfunc noop() -> void

Does nothing, used to end a chain. Usually it's better to rather use chain-ending methods like for_each or to. Can be used to suppress The function 'map_out_mtd()' returns a value, but this value is never used. and similar.

linkfunc sample()

Get a random item (crashes on an empty array).

Examples: G([1]).sample() returns 1
G(["Frog", "Toad"]).sample() returns "Frog" or "Toad" with an equal chance
G([]).sample() crashes

linkfunc sample_or_null()

Get a random item (null on an empty array).

Examples: G([1]).sample_or_null() returns 1
G(["Frog", "Toad"]).sample_or_null() returns "Frog" or "Toad" with an equal chance
G([]).sample_or_null() returns null

linkfunc flatten_raw() -> GGArray

Flattens GGArray of Arrays to GGArray (spreads items).

Examples: G([[1, 2], [3]]).flatten_raw().val returns [1, 2, 3]

linkfunc flatten() -> GGArray

Flattens GGArray of GGArrays to GGArray (spreads items).

Examples: G([G([1, 2]), G([3])]).flatten().val returns [1, 2, 3]

linkfunc take(n: int) -> GGArray

Take n items from a start of an array.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]).take(2).val returns [1, 2]

linkfunc take_right(n: int) -> GGArray

Take n items from an end of an array.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]).take_right(2).val returns [4, 5]

linkfunc take_while(p) -> GGArray

Keep taking items from an array (from start) until predicate stops holding.

Parameters: p: FuncLike<T, bool> Predicate

linkfunc drop(n: int) -> GGArray

Drop (skip) n items from a start of an array.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]).drop(2).val returns [3, 4, 5]

linkfunc drop_right(n: int) -> GGArray

Drop (skip) n items from an end of an array.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]).drop_right(2).val returns [1, 2, 3]

linkfunc reverse() -> GGArray

Reverse order of items in an array.

Examples: G([1, 2, 3]).reverse().val returns [3, 2, 1]

linkfunc tap(f) -> GGArray

Call FuncLike with inner value, ignore call result, return same array.

Parameters: f: FuncLike<T, any>

Returns: GGArray<T>

linkfunc sum() -> int

Sum all items in an array.

Examples: G([2, 3, 5]).sum() returns 10

linkfunc product() -> int

Multiply all items in an array.

Examples: G([2, 3, 5]).product() returns 30

linkfunc all(p) -> bool

Does a predicate hold for all items?

Parameters: p: FuncLike<T, bool>

Returns: bool

Examples: G([]).all("x => x > 0") returns true
G([1, 2, 1]).all("x => x > 0") returns true
G([1, 0, 1]).all("x => x > 0") returns false

linkfunc any(p) -> bool

Does a predicate hold for any item?

Parameters: p: FuncLike<T, bool>

Returns: bool

Examples: G([]).any("x => x == 2") returns false
G([1, 2, 1]).any("x => x == 2") returns true
G([1, -1, 1]).any("x => x == 2") returns false

linkfunc append(y) -> GGArray

Append an item to an end of the array.

linkfunc prepend(y) -> GGArray

Prepend an item to a start of the array.

linkfunc concat(other: Array) -> GGArray

Concatenate arrays (other to end).

linkfunc concat_left(other: Array) -> GGArray

Concatenate arrays (other to start)

linkfunc group_with(f) -> GGArray

Go through an array in order and group together sequences of items for which f returns same value.

Type parameters: U: any Type of values for comparison (usually a type of field of Object/Dictionary)

Parameters: f: FuncLike<T, U> Mapping function used on all items and retuned values are used for comparisons

Returns: GGArray<GGArray<T>> Grouped items

Examples: G([{name = "Walt", rank = 0}, {name = "Muffy", rank = 0}, {name = "Yen", rank = 1}]).group_with("x => x.rank") returns GGArrays equivalent to [[{name = "Walt", rank = 0}, {name = "Muffy", rank = 0}], [{name = "Yen", rank = 1}]]

linkfunc transpose() -> GGArray

Transpose a 2D matrix.

Examples: G([[1, 2], [3, 4]]).transpose() returns GGArrays equivalent to [[1, 3], [2, 4]]

linkfunc wrap() -> GGArray

Wrap inner Arrays with GGArray.

linkfunc unwrap() -> GGArray

Unwrap inner GGArrays to Arrays.

linkfunc nub() -> GGArray

Cut all sequences of same values to be of length one.

linkfunc uniq() -> GGArray

Remove all duplicate items.

linkfunc float_arr_to_int_arr() -> GGArray

Convert array of floats to array of integers. Useful for correcting parsed JSONs.

linkGoldenGadget.gd

If some function is undocumented here (e.g. size_), please see documentation of GGArray.

FuncLike<A, B> means function-like value which represents a function taking one argument of type A and returns value of type B.

linkfunc arr(array) -> GGArray

Wraps Array into GGArray. Recommended "import" (code at a start of a file we want to use the arr in):
func G(arr) -> GGArray: return GG.arr(arr)

Parameters: arr: Array<T> array to wrap

Returns: GGArray<T> wrapped array

linkfunc quit_(error_code: int = 0) -> void

Terminate/halt/quit program.

Parameters: error_code: int Exit code returned from the Godot process (0 means normal exit, >0 means an error)

linkfunc assert_(cond: bool, msg: String) -> void

Assert condition is true, terminate program with error message otherwise.

linkfunc crash_(msg: String) -> void

Terminate program with error message.

linkfunc l_and_(x: bool, y: bool) -> bool

logical and

linkfunc l_or_(x: bool, y: bool) -> bool

logical or

linkfunc add_(x: int, y: int) -> int

adds two values

linkfunc subtract_(x: int, y: int) -> int

subtracts second argument from first

linkfunc a_and_(x: Array) -> bool

and operation performed on array of bools

Parameters: x: Array<bool>

Returns: bool

linkfunc a_or_(x: Array) -> bool

or operation performed on array of bools

Parameters: x: Array<bool>

Returns: bool

linkfunc eq_(a, b) -> bool

shallow equality check

linkfunc neq_(a, b) -> bool

shallow not-equality check

linkfunc eqd_(a, b) -> bool

deep equality check

linkfunc eq_field_(object, args) -> bool

determines equality (==) of a field (given name and value in args parameter) in object (first parameter)

linkfunc call_spread_(f: FuncRef, arr: Array)

Invoke a function with parameters given in array.

linkfunc snake_to_pascal_case_(x: String) -> String

Convert string from snake to pascal case

linkfunc snake_to_camel_case_(x: String) -> String

Convert string from snake to camel case.

linkfunc camel_to_snake_case_(x: String) -> String

Convert string from camel to snake case.

linkfunc capitalize_(x: String) -> String

Capitalize string - convert first character to upper case and all other to lower case.

linkfunc capitalize_first_(x: String) -> String

Capitalize first character of string (doesn't touch other characters).

linkfunc capitalize_all_(x: String) -> String

Capitalize all characters.

linkfunc decapitalize_first_(x: String) -> String

Decapitalize first character of string (doesn't touch other characters).

linkfunc noop1_(x) -> void

Do nothing.

Parameters: x: any

linkfunc noop2_(x, y) -> void

Do nothing.

Parameters: x: any
y: any

linkfunc noop3_(x, y, z) -> void

Do nothing.

Parameters: x: any
y: any
z: any

linkfunc noop4_(x, y, z, a) -> void

Do nothing.

Parameters: x: any
y: any
z: any
a: any

linkfunc multiply_(x, y)

Multiple two numbers.

linkfunc modulo_(x, y)

Calculate modulo of two numbers (of same type).

Parameters: x: int | float First number
y: int | float Second number

Returns: int | float Modulo of input numbers, has same type.

linkfunc inc_(x)

Add one to a given number.

linkfunc dec_(x)

Subtract one from a given number.

linkfunc negate_num_(x)

Negate given number.

linkfunc negate_(x: bool) -> bool

Logic not.

linkfunc get_fld_(obj, field_name: String)

Get a value in a given field.
Crashes on a missing field.

Parameters: obj: Object | Dictionary
field_name: String

Returns: any

linkfunc get_fld_or_else_(obj, field_name: String, default)

Get a value in a given field. If the field is missing, return a given default value.

Parameters: obj: Object | Dictionary
field_name: String
default: any

Returns: any

linkfunc get_fld_or_null_(obj, field_name: String)

Get a value in a given field. If the field is missing, return null.

Parameters: obj: Object | Dictionary
field_name: String
default: any

Returns: any

linkfunc fst_(pair: Array)

Get a first item in a pair.

linkfunc snd_(pair: Array)

Get a second item in a pair.

linkfunc compile_script_(src: String)

Compile script and return new instance of it.

linkfunc compile_function_(expr: String) -> FuncRef

Compile a script with one function, instantiate the script and return a funcref of the function.

linkfunc F_(f)

Create function-like object depending on type of f.

  • FuncRef - pass same value
  • String - compiles function and returns its FuncRef
    "x => x + 1" ~ get FuncRef of func f(x): return x + 1
  • Array - partial application (creates CtxFRef1) ["x, y => x + y", 1] which is functionally equivalent to "x => x + 1"

Parameters: f: FuncRef | String | Array<any>

Returns: FuncRef | CtxFRef1

linkfunc keys_(obj)

Get keys of Dictionary or Object.

Parameters: obj: Dictionary | Object

Returns: Array<String>

Examples: GG.keys_({a = 1, b = 2}) returns ["a", "b"]

linkfunc key_from_val_(obj, val)

Get key by given value. Supports Dictionary and Object (custom classes).
Useful for finding a name of an enum item from an item value.

Parameters: obj: Dictionary | Object
val: any

Returns: any | null Returns null if value is not found.

Examples: GG.key_from_val_({a = 1, b = 2}, 1) returns "a".

linkfunc ap_if_defined_(obj, method_name: String, args: Array)

Call a method when the method exists and return its result, otherwise return null.

Parameters: obj: Object Object owning the method
method_name: String Object owning the method
args: Array<any> Arguments to pass to the method

Returns: any What method returned, or null when obj is null or obj has no such method

Examples: GG.ap_if_defined_(GG, "add_", [2, 5]) returns 7
GG.ap_if_defined_(GG, "_non_existing_method", [2, 5]) returns null

linkfunc sample_(arr: Array)

Get a random item from an array.
Crashes on an empty array.

Type parameters: T: any type of items in the array

Parameters: arr: Array<T> the input array

Returns: T a randomly picked item

Examples: sample_([1, 2]) returns 1 or 2 with equal chance
sample_([]) crashes

linkfunc sample_or_null_(arr: Array)

Get a random item from an array.

Type parameters: T: any type of items in the array

Parameters: arr: Array<T> the input array

Returns: T | null a random item, or null for an empty array

Examples: sample_or_null_([1, 2]) returns 1 or 2 with equal chance
sample_or_null_([]) returns always null

linkfunc format_datetime_(date = null) -> String

Format DateTime (if no provided, current will be used) in following format: YYYY-MM-DD--HH-MM-SS

Parameters: date: DateTime | null

Returns: String

Examples: Possible output: "2019-12-19--13-03-18"

linkfunc floats_are_equal_(x: float, y: float, eps = 1.0e-4) -> bool

Test if two float values are same (withing maring of eps).

Parameters: x: float first value
y: float second value
eps: float accepted margin

Returns: bool

linkfunc format_float_2_(x) -> String

Format float to 2 decimal places.

Parameters: x: float | null

Returns: String

Examples: format_float_2_(1.23456) returns "1.23"

linkfunc format_vec2_2_(x) -> String

Format Vector2 to 2 decimal places.

Parameters: x: Vector2 | null

Returns: String

Examples: format_vec2_2_(Vector2(1.2345, 0)) returns "1.23, 0.00"

linkfunc format_vec3_2_(x) -> String

Format Vector3 to 2 decimal places.

Parameters: x: Vector3 | null

Returns: String

Examples: format_vec3_2_(Vector3(1.2345, 0, 7)) returns "1.23, 0.00, 7.00"

linkfunc take_screenshot_(options: Dictionary = <<TODO: ELit (LDictionary [])>>) -> Dictionary

Save a screenshot.
Optionally takes an options dictionary:

  • quiet - when true silence all console output
  • dir - overrides screenshot directory (default is "user://screenshots", expanded for example like this: "/home/user/.local/share/godot/app_userdata/project/screenshots") Returns dictionary with following fields:
  • dir - screenshot directory. Example: "/home/user/.local/share/godot/app_userdata/project/screenshots"
  • result - Error code, use OK constant to test if taking screenshot was successful. Example: 12
  • stage - last reached stage, either "create_dir" or "save". Example: "save"
  • file_name - image file name (without directory). Example: "2019-12-19--13-20-35.png"
  • full_file_name - full path to screenshot file. Example: "/home/user/.local/share/godot/app_userdata/project/screenshots/2019-12-19--13-20-35.png"

linkfunc delete_children_(parent: Node) -> void

Delete all children of a given parent (calls queue_free on children).

linkfunc get_children_rec_(parent: Node) -> Array

Get recursively all children.

Parameters: parent: Node

Returns: Array<Node>

linkfunc get_node_or_crash_(parent, path) -> Node

Safer get_node alternative which will crash when a parent, a path or a node are null/empty.

Parameters: parent: Node | null Of which node we want to retrieve a child
path: NodePath | null Path to a child

Returns: Node | null Child node or null on failure

linkfunc get_node_or_null_(parent, path)

Get a child node. If there is any problem, return null.

Parameters: parent: Node | null Of which node we want to retrieve a child
path: NodePath | null Path to a child

Returns: Node | null Child node or null on failure

linkfunc create_timer_and_start_(on: Node, method_name: String, time: float, one_shot = true) -> Timer

Create a Timer node, connect timeout signal to the method and start.

Parameters: on: Node Parent node for Timer, contains callback method
method_name: String Name of a method which is called after timer finishes
time: float Amount of time in seconds before callback method is called
one_shot: bool Should the new Timer run in one-shot mode? If it does, Timer is destroyed after time elapses, otherwise Timer remains.

Returns: Timer New Timer node

linkfunc words_raw_(x: String) -> Array

Split a string to an array of words.

Parameters: x: String Input string

Returns: Array<String> words

Examples: words_raw_("a b") will return ["a", "b"].

linkfunc words_(x: String) -> GGArray

Split a string to an array of words.

Parameters: x: String Input string

Returns: GGArray<String> words

Examples: words_("a b") will return arr(["a", "b"]).

linkfunc unwords_(xs: Array) -> String

Join words array to one string

Parameters: xs: Array<String> Input array of words

Returns: String Joined words

Examples: unwords_(["a", "b"]) returns "a b"

linkfunc lines_raw_(x: String) -> Array

Split string with new line sequences to an array of lines
Same as lines_, but returns Array<String> instead of GGArray<String>.

linkfunc lines_(x: String) -> GGArray

Split string with new line sequences to an array of lines

Parameters: x: String Input text

Returns: GGArray<String> Array containing lines as items (without new line sequences)

Examples: lines_("a\n\nb") returns arr(["a", "b"])

linkfunc unlines_(xs: Array) -> String

Join an array of lines to a string.

Examples: unlines_(["a", "b"]) returns "a\nb"

linkfunc pipe_(input, functions: Array, options = null)

Calls first function with given input then sequentially takes a result from a previous function and passes it to a next one.
Supports lambdas (string, e.g. "x => x + 1") and partial application of 2 argument functions (e.g. [GG.take, 2]) Options dictionary fields:

  • print - if true then input, middle values and result is printed

Examples: pipe_(0, [inc_, inc_]) returns 2, it is equivalent to inc_(inc_(0)). pipe_([1, 2], [[GG.take, 1], "xs => xs[0] * 10"]) returns 10, it is equivalent to take_([1, 2], 1)[0] * 10.

linkfunc flow_(functions: Array)

Similar to pipe_, but returns "piped" function composed from all passed functions.
If you intend to call the resulting function immediately, use rather pipe_ for better performance.

linkfunc id_(x)

Identity function - returns same value it got in an argument.

Type parameters: T: any

Parameters: x: T Input value

Returns: T Same value as on input

linkfunc const_(x)

Construct a function accepting one argument.
This new function ignores passed argument and always returns x (an argument it was created with).

Type parameters: T: any

Parameters: x: T Value to be returned from constructed function

Returns: FuncLike<any, T>

Examples: const_(1).call_func("Gorn") returns 1
const_("Resistance is futile!").call_func("Resist!") returns "Resistance is futile!"

linkfunc tap_(x, f)

Call function-like f with x, return x (ignore return value of f).

Type parameters: T: any

Parameters: x: T Input value
f: FuncLike<T, any> Function accepting input value

Returns: T Input value x

linkfunc fmt_bool_(x: bool) -> String

Format bool (default formatting uses upper-case, this function uses lower-case).

Parameters: x: bool Input value

Returns: String Formatted value

linkfunc replicate_(x, n: int) -> Array

Create an array of length n where all items are x.

Type parameters: T: any

Parameters: x: T Item used for filling the array
n: int Number of items

Returns: Array<T>

Examples: replicate_("a", 3) returns ["a", "a", "a"]

linkfunc new_array_(zero, dimensions: Array) -> Array

Create an n-dimensional array and fill its every cell with given zero value

Type parameters: T: any

Parameters: zero: T Value to assign to all cells
dimensions: Array<int> Dimensions (lengths) of new nested array.

Returns: Array<any> Nested (n-dimensional) array

Examples: new_array_(0, [1]) returns [0]
new_array_(0, [3]) returns [0, 0, 0]
new_array_(0, [1, 2]) returns [[0, 0]]
new_array_("x", [2, 3]) returns [["x", "x", "x"], ["x", "x", "x"]]

linkfunc generate_array_(cell_value_getter, dimensions: Array) -> Array

Create an n-dimensional array and fill its every cell with a value returned by cell_value_getter.

Type parameters: T: any

Parameters: cell_value_getter: FuncLike<Array<int>, T> Function which accepts coordinates (array of numbers) and returns a value for a cell on those coordinates
dimensions: Array<int> Dimensions (lengths) of new nested array.

Returns: Array<any> Nested (n-dimensional) array

Examples: generate_array_(GG.id, [3]) returns [[0], [1], [2]]
generate_array_("x => x[0] * 10 + x[1]", [2, 3]) returns [ [0, 1, 2], [10, 11, 12] ]

linkfunc float_arr_to_int_arr_(arr: Array) -> Array

Convert array of floats to array of integers. Useful for correcting parsed JSONs.

Parameters: arr: Array<float>

Returns: Array<int>

Examples: float_arr_to_int_arr_([1.0, 2.0]) returns [1, 2]

linkfunc get_fields_(obj, field_names: Array) -> Array

Get field values from given object/dictionary as an array (indices of output array matches those of input array)

Parameters: obj: Object | Dictionary Input value
field_names: Array<String> Names of fields to read values from

Returns: Array<any> Read values of given fields

Examples: get_fields_({x = 2, y = true}, ["x", "y"]) returns [2, true]

linkfunc set_fields_(obj, values: Array, field_names: Array) -> void

Set field values of object/dictionary according to arrays of values and field names (indices of arrays match).

Parameters: obj: Object | Dictionary Target for setting values on
values: Array<any> List of values
field_names: Array<string> List of corresponding field names

Returns: void

Examples: var dict = {x = 2, y = true}; GG.set_fields_(dict, [69, false], ["x", "y"]) results in dict to be equal to {x = 69, y = false}

linkfunc bool_(cond: bool, on_false, on_true)

Return on_false/on_true depending on value of cond

Type parameters: T: any Return type

Parameters: cond: bool Condition
on_false: T Value to return when cond is false
on_true: T Value to return when cond is true

Returns: T

Examples: bool_(true, 0, 1) returns 1
bool_(x == 0, "not zero", "is zero") returns "is zero" when x is 0, otherwise returns "not zero"

linkfunc bool_lazy_(cond: bool, on_false, on_true)

Same as bool_, but on_false/on_true are functions.
Only selected function will be called and its return value will be returned from bool_lazy.

Type parameters: T: any Return type

Parameters: cond: bool Condition
on_false: FuncLike<T> Function to call and return its result when cond is false
on_true: FuncLike<T> Function to call and return its result when cond is true

Returns: T

linkfunc pause_one_(node: Node, value: bool) -> void

Pause specific node. Disables all processing by a given node.

Parameters: node: Node Branch to pause.
value: bool True means pause, false means resume (unpause)

linkfunc pause_(node: Node, value: bool) -> void

Pause a branch starting with given node (recursive variant of pause_one_).

Parameters: node: Node Branch to pause.
value: bool True means pause, false means resume (unpause)

linkfunc rand_dir2_() -> Vector2

Get random direction 2D vector.

linkfunc rand_dir3_() -> Vector3

Get random direction 3D vector.

linkfunc rand_sign_()

Get randomly 1 or -1.

linkfunc rand_bool_()

Get random bool.

linkfunc dir_to2_(from: Node2D, to: Node2D) -> Vector2

Get direction between two Node2Ds.

linkfunc dir_to3_(from: Spatial, to: Spatial) -> Vector3

Get direction between two Spatials.

linkfunc clampi_(value: int, min_val: int, max_val: int) -> int

Limit given integer number to specified range.

linkfunc absi_(value: int) -> int

Get absolute value of an integer (distance from zero).

linkfunc is_empty_(arr: Array) -> bool

Is given array empty?
